name: azatadine
content: Azatadine (Optimine) is a first-generation antihistamine and anticholinergic drug that was synthesized in 1963 by Schering-Plough, a former American pharmaceutical company. It was patented in 1967.  It has been succeeded by both loratadine and desloratadine.: 53  and marketing approvals have been widely withdrawn.: 290    == See also == Azatadine/pseudoephedrine   == References ==
